content:
Yes, there are several other historical landmarks in Stranraer that you may find fascinating. Here are some of the must-see landmarks in the area:

1. Castle Kennedy Gardens: This historic estate has beautiful gardens, a castle, and a loch. The gardens are open to the public from April to October, and visitors can enjoy a stroll around the estate, take a boat ride on the loch, and visit the castle.

2. Mull of Galloway Lighthouse: This lighthouse is located on the southernmost point of Scotland and offers stunning views of the Irish Sea. Visitors can climb to the top of the lighthouse for panoramic views, explore the nearby wildlife reserve, or take a scenic coastal walk.

3. Glenluce Abbey: This medieval abbey is a beautiful example of Scottish architecture and history. Visitors can explore the ruins of the abbey, learn about the monks who lived there, and enjoy a walk through the surrounding countryside.

4. Cairnryan Port: This port played a crucial role in World War II and is still an important transportation hub today. Visitors can learn about the history of the port, explore the nearby beaches, or take a ferry to nearby destinations like Belfast or Larne.

These landmarks are sure to make your visit to Stranraer a memorable one!
